author: guilhermesalgado9479
content: <@!489256758989029405> I've generated http://sprunge.us/BLabrj based on that genesis file Mateusz sent by email, but it's giving me a different genesis hash (0x665da6bac91a9e41049097b0749367ead5fc74a64e22f84b331e6a949198fa4f) than what your node is reporting (0x14a2603062751658538211f50bc7bac02572f16fd3d7e4f29257dac34165a61a), so the eth handshake fails. Any idea what I could be missing?

author: guilhermesalgado9479
content: I guess that's because of the contract accounts in your genesis... I'm not sure how to represent those in eip-1085 format. Can you remove them from your genesis?

author: tkstanczak
content: <@!482518216019542016> I am pretty user you can define the initial accounts (for example for mainnet which had all the premine accounts)

author: tkstanczak
content: as for gossiping -> we already have the newblockhashes message so there is no need to duplicate it

author: tkstanczak
content: we can use it for gossipping

author: tkstanczak
content: any node supporting wit, whenever publishing newblockhashes, announces the witness availability for these

author: tkstanczak
content: So, in this way, I feel that publishing NewBlockWitness is just a duplicate. Can you see a scenario where these messages are not identical? Let me know.

author: guilhermesalgado9479
content:
> <@!482518216019542016> I am pretty user you can define the initial accounts (for example for mainnet which had all the premine accounts)
<@!489256758989029405> right, but it'd take some figuring out so if those accounts are not necessary for our initial tests I'd appreciate if we could drop them

author: tkstanczak
content: they are necessary - otherwise we will not be able to create any transactions on the chain

author: tkstanczak
content: there would be no ether in existence except for the miner reward (which is set to zero I believe)

author: pipermerriam
content: We should be able to support them just fine in our EIP-1085 genesis file.  If you can generate one account for us in there too we'd appreciate it (or you can just xfer some play-money to an account we control once the chain is up and running)

author: guilhermesalgado9479
content: <@!489256758989029405> I can connect to your node now, but it doesn't seem to advertise the wit protocol in the base-proto handshake

content: all these accounts are with simple private keys (from 0 to 10)

author: tkstanczak
content: you can use them freely
